class.name: TridiagonalDoubleMatrix2D

javadoc.text:
Tridiagonal 2-d matrix holding double elements. * First see the package summary and javadoc tree view to get the broad picture. *

* Implementation: * TODO.
javadoc.author: wolfgang.hoschek@cern.ch

javadoc.text:
Constructs a matrix with a copy of the given values. * values is required to have the form values[row][column] * and have exactly the same number of columns in every row. *

* The values are copied. So subsequent changes in values are not reflected in the matrix, and vice-versa.
javadoc.param: values The values to be filled into the new matrix.
javadoc.throws: IllegalArgumentException if <tt>for any 1 <= row < values.length: values[row].length != values[row-1].length</tt>.

javadoc.text: Constructs a matrix with a given number of rows and columns. * All entries are initially <tt>0</tt>.
javadoc.param: rows the number of rows the matrix shall have.
columns the number of columns the matrix shall have.

method.name: TridiagonalDoubleMatrix2D
method.comment: {lowerStart, diagonalStart, upperStart, values.length, lowerNonZeros, diagonalNonZeros, upperNonZeros}

javadoc.text: Sets all cells to the state specified by <tt>value</tt>.
javadoc.param: value the value to be filled into the cells.

method.name: assign
method.comment: the funny definition of isNaN(). This should better not happen.

javadoc.text: Replaces all cell values of the receiver with the values of another matrix. * Both matrices must have the same number of rows and columns. * If both matrices share the same cells (as is the case if they are views derived from the same matrix) and intersect in an ambiguous way, then replaces as if using an intermediate auxiliary deep copy of other.
javadoc.param: source the source matrix to copy from (may be identical to the receiver).

javadoc.text: Returns the content of this matrix if it is a wrapper; or <tt>this</tt> otherwise. * Override this method in wrappers.

Returns the matrix cell value at coordinate [row,column]. *

Provided with invalid parameters this method may return invalid objects without throwing any exception. * You should only use this method when you are absolutely sure that the coordinate is within bounds. * Precondition (unchecked): 0 <= column < columns() && 0 <= row < rows().
javadoc.param: row the index of the row-coordinate.
column the index of the column-coordinate.
javadoc.return: the value at the specified coordinate.

javadoc.text: Construct and returns a new empty matrix of the same dynamic type as the receiver, having the specified number of rows and columns. * For example, if the receiver is an instance of type DenseDoubleMatrix2D the new matrix must also be of type DenseDoubleMatrix2D, * if the receiver is an instance of type SparseDoubleMatrix2D the new matrix must also be of type SparseDoubleMatrix2D, etc. * In general, the new matrix should have internal parametrization as similar as possible.
javadoc.param: rows the number of rows the matrix shall have.
columns the number of columns the matrix shall have.
javadoc.return: a new empty matrix of the same dynamic type.

javadoc.text: Construct and returns a new 1-d matrix of the corresponding dynamic type, entirelly independent of the receiver. * For example, if the receiver is an instance of type DenseDoubleMatrix2D the new matrix must be of type DenseDoubleMatrix1D, * if the receiver is an instance of type SparseDoubleMatrix2D the new matrix must be of type SparseDoubleMatrix1D, etc.
javadoc.param: size the number of cells the matrix shall have.
javadoc.return: a new matrix of the corresponding dynamic type.

javadoc.text:
Sets the matrix cell at coordinate [row,column] to the specified value. *

Provided with invalid parameters this method may access illegal indexes without throwing any exception. * You should only use this method when you are absolutely sure that the coordinate is within bounds. * Precondition (unchecked): 0 <= column < columns() && 0 <= row < rows().
javadoc.param: row the index of the row-coordinate.
column the index of the column-coordinate.
value the value to be filled into the specified cell.

method.name: setQuick
method.comment: if (!isZero) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Can't store non-zero value to non-tridiagonal coordinate: row="+row+", column="+column+", value="+value);
if (!isZero) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Can't store non-zero value to non-tridiagonal coordinate: row="+row+", column="+column+", value="+value);

The non zero elements of the matrix: {lower, diagonal, upper}.

The startIndexes and number of non zeros: {lowerStart, diagonalStart, upperStart, values.length, lowerNonZeros, diagonalNonZeros, upperNonZeros}. lowerStart = 0 diagonalStart = lowerStart + lower.length upperStart = diagonalStart + diagonal.length
